FuncDef: The display pim routing-table command displays PIM routing entries in the PIM routing table.
CLIs: display pim routing-table brief [ <groupAddr> [ mask { <group-mask-length> | <group-mask-addr> } ] | <srcAddr> [ mask { <source-mask-length> | <source-mask-addr> } ] | incoming-interface { { <iif-port-type> <iif-port-num> | <iif-port-name> } | register | through-bgp | pseudo | mcast-extranet | clone } ] *

display pim { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | all-instance } routing-table brief [ <groupAddr> [ mask { <group-mask-length> | <group-mask-addr> } ] | <srcAddr> [ mask { <source-mask-length> | <source-mask-addr> } ] | incoming-interface { { <iif-port-type> <iif-port-num> | <iif-port-name> } | register | through-bgp | pseudo | mcast-extranet | clone } ] *
display pim { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | all-instance } routing-table outgoing-interface-number [ <oif-number> ]
display pim { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> | all-instance } routing-table [ rpf-vector [ verbose ] ]

display pim vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> routing-table { <groupAddr> [ mask { <group-mask-length> | <group-mask-addr> } ] | <srcAddr> [ mask { <source-mask-length> | <source-mask-addr> } ] | incoming-interface { { <iif-port-type> <iif-port-num> | <iif-port-name> } | register | through-bgp | pseudo | mcast-extranet } | outgoing-interface { include | exclude | match } { { <oif-port-type> <oif-port-num> | <oif-port-name> } | register | none | pseudo } | mode { ssm | sm } | flags { 2msdp | act | del | exprune | ext | loc | msdp | niif | nonbr | none | rpt | sg_rcvr | sgjoin | spt | swt | upchg | wc | excl | bgp | 2bgp | extranet | pd | bs } | fsm | extranet { source-vpn-instance { vpn-instance <source-vpn-instance-name> | all | public } | receive-vpn-instance { vpn-instance <receive-vpn-instance-name> | all } } | backup-incoming-interface { { <biif-port-type> <biif-port-num> | <biif-port-name> } | register | through-bgp | pseudo | mcast-extranet } } * [ outgoing-interface-number [ <oif-number> ] ]

display pim all-instance routing-table { <groupAddr> [ mask { <group-mask-length> | <group-mask-addr> } ] | <srcAddr> [ mask { <source-mask-length> | <source-mask-addr> } ] | incoming-interface { { <iif-port-type> <iif-port-num> | <iif-port-name> } | register | through-bgp | pseudo } | outgoing-interface { include | exclude | match } { { <oif-port-type> <oif-port-num> | <oif-port-name> } | register | none | pseudo } | mode { ssm | sm } | flags { 2msdp | act | del | exprune | ext | loc | msdp | niif | nonbr | none | rpt | sg_rcvr | sgjoin | spt | swt | upchg | wc | excl | bgp | 2bgp } | fsm } * [ outgoing-interface-number [ <oif-number> ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays PIM routing entries of a specified VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Displays PIM routing entries of all instances.
-

Displays PIM routing entries that contain a specified group address.
The value ranges from 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255, in dotted decimal notation.

Displays PIM routing entries that contain a specified source or group address mask.
-

Displays PIM routing entries that contain a specified group address mask length.
group-mask-length specifies the length of a group address mask.
The value is an integer that ranges from 4 to 32.

Displays PIM routing entries that contain a specified group address mask.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays PIM routing entries that contain a specified source address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays PIM routing entries that contain a specified source address mask length.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 32.

Displays PIM routing entries that contain a specified source address mask.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays PIM routing entries of a specified inbound interface.
-

Specifies the type of an inbound interface.
-

Specifies the number of an inbound interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of an inbound interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Displays PIM routing entries of register interfaces.
-

Displays PIM routing entries of outbound interfaces.
-

Displays PIM routing information of interfaces that are included in the outbound interface list.
-

Displays PIM routing entries of interfaces that are excluded from the outbound interface list.
-

Displays PIM routing entries of a specified interface in the outbound interface list.
-

Specifies the outbound interface type.
-

Specifies the outbound interface number.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the outbound interfacename.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Indicates that the downstream interface list does not have any routing entry.
Displays PIM routing entries of an outbound interface list that does not contain any interfaces.
-

Displays PIM routing entries of a specified PIM mode.
-

Source specific multicast routes.
-

Sparse mode routes.
-

Routes matching these flags.
-

Indicates that the RP receives a Register message recently and learns the (S, G) entry. The RP prepares to inform Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) of the source active (SA) message that contains the (S, G) entry.
-

Indicates that the multicast routing entry at which actual data arrives exists.
-

Indicates the multicast routing entry to be deleted.
-

Indicates that the entry on the rendezvous point tree (RPT) is pruned and no receiver on the RPT requests the information sent by the source.
-

Indicates routing entries that contain outgoing interfaces provided by other multicast routing protocols.
-

Indicates routing entries on the router directly connected to the network segment where the source resides.
-

Indicates the routing entries learned from recently received MSDP SA messages.
-

Indicates routing entries with unknown incoming interfaces.
-

Indicates that the routing entry of the upstream neighbor address (link-local address) towards the RP or the source is not found.
-

Indicates the routing entries that are on the RPT but do not use the RPT data.
-

Indicates that the (S, G) receiver of S exists on the local router and PIM is the owner of the downstream interface.
-

Indicates that the (S, G) receiver of S exists on the local router and PIM is not the owner of the downstream interface.
-

Indicates routing entries on the shortest path tree (SPT).
-

Indicates routing entries during the SPT switchover.
-

Identifies the route change. It indicates that the current entry uses the original upstream interface to forward data and waits for data received from a new interface.
-

Indicates a (*, G) entry.
-

Indicates an (S, G) entry created after an IGMPv3 packet is received in exclude mode.
-

Indicates routing entries learned from Source Active A-D routes received by BGP.
-

Indicates that the local device is ready to advertise Source Active A-D routes through BGP.
-

Detailed information of FSM states.
-

Specify the number of interfaces.
-

Summary information.
-

Displays PIM routing entries of interfaces that use BGP to send signaling.
-

MVPN pseudo interface.
-

Displays PIM routing entries with upstream interfaces being extranet interfaces.
-

MoFRR clone interface.
-

Displays PIM routing entries that contain the RPF vector information.
-

Detailed information.
-

Specifies the name of an outbound VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Dense mode routes.
-

Indicates that a receiver VPN instance receives an extranet-added PIM routing entry.
-

Specifies the name of a source VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Displays PIM routing entries of the current instance with sources belonging to instances.
-

Specify public network instance.
-

Specifies the name of a receive VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

MoFRR clone pseudo interface.
-

Indicates Join-Prune queue in pruning delay mode exists.
-

Indicates backup inbound interface forwarding entry is suppressed in PIM FRR.
-

Specifies the type of an MFP routing entry.
-

Specifies the type of an MFB routing entry.
-

Displays routing entries with the backup inbound interface being the specified interface.
-

Specifies the type of a backup interface.
-

Specifies the number of a backup interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the name of a backup interface.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the type of a frrchg routing entry.
-

Specify bas interface.
-

Examples: Abbreviations for FSM states and Timers:
NI - no info, J - joined, NJ - not joined, P - pruned,
NP - not pruned, PP - prune pending, W - winner, L - loser,
F - forwarding, AP - ack pending, DR - designated router,
NDR - non-designated router, RCVR - downstream receivers,
PPT - prunepending timer, GRT - graft retry timer,
OT - override timer, PLT - prune limit timer,
ET - join expiry timer, JT - join timer,
AT - assert timer, PT - prune timer,
IN - include state, EX - exclude state
FSM information for non-downstream interfaces: none
Protocol: pim-sm, Flag: SPT ACT PD BS
Join/Prune FSM: [SPT: J, JT Expires: 00:00:27] [RPT: NP]
FSM information for non-downstream interfaces: none
Protocol: pim-sm, Flag: SPT LOC ACT
<HUAWEI> display pim vpn-instance RED routing-table extranet source-vpn-instance BLUE
Total matched 1 (*, G) entry; 1 (S, G) entry
<HUAWEI> display pim vpn-instance BLUE routing-table extranet receive-vpn-instance RED
Total matched 1 (*, G) entry; 1 (S, G) entry
Protocol: pim-sm, Flag: SPT ACT EXTRANET
Protocol: pim-sm, Flag: SPT LOC ACT
Total matched 0 (*, G) entry; 1 (S, G) entry
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The display pim routing-table command displays contents in a PIM routing table, including information about multicast source and group addresses, RPs, inbound interfaces, and outbound interface lists in (S, G) and (*, G) entries.
Precautions
If vpn-instance or all-instance is specified, no VPN instance can be specified for an outbound interface. That is, neither vpn-instance nor all-instance can be specified after outgoing-interface is specified.If neither vpn-instance nor all-instance is specified, the command displays PIM routing entries of the public network instance.
